title: Legendary singer Patti Smith shares her thoughts on Donald Trump and defends Greta Thunberg
text:
Patti Smith appeared on Australia's The Sunday Project current affairs program to promote her latest book, Year Of The Monkey, on Sunday night.

And the legendary singer was candid when asked to share her thoughts on President Donald Trump and teenage climate change activist Greta Thunberg.

The 72-year-old says she encountered Trump in New York before he became president and was not impressed.

'I found him egotistical': Legendary singer Patti Smith (pictured) shared her thoughts on Donald Trump and Greta Thunberg while appearing on The Sunday Project on Sunday night

'I found him egotistical and insufferable but I never dreamed that he would become President,' Patti told host Lisa Wilkinson bluntly.

'So my opinion of him was never very good and it has not changed,' she said.

Patti added, 'He was probably voted in by less than 26% of the population.'

The poet and punk rocker was more positive when the topic of Greta Thunberg was raised.

She said: 'Greta Thunberg makes me optimistic. To see millions of people striking for climate change awareness makes me optimistic.

'I don't pin my hopes on her. I pin my hopes on all of us who heed the words that she is speaking. The words that are already in our heart.

'She is a strong, clean, honest voice. And she is inspiring millions of people to act. And that's what I pin my hope on - action.'

When asked why Greta has faced so much criticism, Patti shot back: 'Truth always upsets people.

'Whether it's in art or political movements. It's truth that both moves and frightens people the most.'

Patti is due to perform in Australia in April 2020, where she will appear at the Bluesfest festival.

Bluesfest is scheduled to hold its 30th edition in Byron Bay between April 9 and April 13, with tickets on sale through Moshtix.

Patti's latest book, The New York Times bestseller, Year of the Monkey, is out now.

In addition to an illustrious music career, the singer-songwriter has published 25 books, including multiple memoirs and volumes of poetry.
